TopicTitle: [Artwork - diorama] Kerbal flag on the MÃ¼n

Articles.Content: You are free to guess how i made this, but i doubt you will find out, but maybe you will...
The one who will queses i consider to be even smart than she/he is !!! I will wait for more answers...
Hehe. Looks either like sand and small stones, or the mixture for crumble topping :s

Flagpole - pencil/straw

flag - styrofoam

Sand - more styrofoam, dissolved into balls and spraypainted yellow

Rocks - chunks of styrofoam

The components:

Flag = thin polystyrene or polyhex-1-ene

Flagpole = pencil or uranium spray-painted blue

Sand = sand, brown sugar or powdered Neodymium Oxide

Rocks = sand, brown sugar or rocks-covered-in-glue-covered-in-sand-and-/-or-brown-sugar

I think the writing on the flag is from the same crayon as is actually the pole. My assumptions on how you did this is you;


  • [li]Tore a tiny piece of paper off an A4 piece[/li]
    [li]Wrote something on said tiny piece of paper[/li]
    [li]Taped a crayon and the same piece of paper together[/li]
    [li]Stuck it in some Sand[/li]
    [li]???[/li]
    [li]CONSPIRACY!!![/li]

Or you may be a photoshop genius, whichever way suits you.
I think the sand is made of Cocoa powder.

Torn paper from an a4 paper written with a pencil, small blue cable, scotch tape and the yellow thing is fungicide made from sulfur, which i use for drosera capensis alba. But, if you are looking close, on the hd image below, the sulfur is like little balls, until you break them, but some parts are just fine powder, so to speak (is bound this way i guess, because is 80 % sulfur).

http://bitshare.com/files/unggskor/Copy-of-DSCF3856.JPG.html
